intro: Pfeiffera mataralensis var. floccosa, commonly known as the Mataral floccose pfeiffera, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique foliage, featuring dense, woolly hairs that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are usually broad and leathery, adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
